action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the counter, the book on the shelf and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a broom closet now. There are a broom and a mop. The broom is on the floor. The mop is on the floor. There is a passage to a hallway here.
You take the broom. In your inventory you have a broom.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a bed and a shelf. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
You can't see a book here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
There is nothing on the shelf.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate and a broom.
You are in a pantry now. There are a refrigerator and a freezer. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a sandwich, a banana, a orange, a peach and a apple.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
You can't see a floor here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
You put the plate on the counter.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a bed and a shelf. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
There is nothing on the bed.
You can't see a pillow here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
I don't know what 'under bed' means.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You can't go to a living room from here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table, a book and a table. The book is on the side table. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a broom and a book.
You can't go to a bedroom from here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a bed and a shelf. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
You put the book on the shelf.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You can't go to a living room from here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a living room, a hallway and a pantry here.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table and a table. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
There is nothing on the couch.
There is nothing on the chair.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
